alert.note: Alert for Morris; Sussex (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 7:22AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Morris and Sussex Counties through 745 AM EDT... At 721 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Dingmans Ferry to Pellettown to near Lake Mohawk. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Montague, Hopatcong, Franklin, Hamburg, Ogdensburg, Sussex, Branchville, High Point, Lake Mohawk, Vernon Valley, Pellettown, Highland Lake, Hainesville and Crandon Lakes. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
